description:
Actinidia chinensis var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese kiwifruit or simply kiwifruit, is a species of woody vine native to central and eastern China. It is a variety of the broader Actinidia chinensis species, which encompasses various cultivars of the kiwifruit.

The Chinese kiwifruit is a fast-growing, deciduous vine that can reach up to 9 meters (30 feet) in length. The leaves are large, rounded, and dark green in color. The flowers are white or pale green and appear in the spring. The fruit is an oval-shaped berry, typically 5-8 cm (2-3 inches) in length, with a fuzzy brown exterior and bright green flesh containing tiny black seeds.

Actinidia chinensis var. chinensis is known for its high nutritional value, being an excellent source of vitamin C, vitamin K, and various other vitamins and minerals. The fruit has a sweet, slightly tart flavor and is widely cultivated for commercial and domestic consumption around the world.
